Subjective: Left ear pain, fullness, decreased hearing. Onset 2-3 days ago, gradual worsening. Pain 0-4/10 constant, 6-7/10 after showering. Aggravated by showering, swimming. Unable to swim due to pain. No fever, no general illness. No prior painkiller use. New sport: swimming (few weeks). Cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. Recently became Dutch citizen. Request: Wants ear examined, worried about ear, wants pain to stop.
Objective: Temp: 36.2 C. Right ear: Clean, eardrum fine. Left ear: Pain on pulling auricle. Red, inflamed, ear canal swollen/thick. Eardrum not well visualized.
Assessment: Left otitis externa. Suspect frequent water exposure (swimming/showering) and cotton bud use.
Plan: Explanation: Left ear canal inflamed due to water exposure and cotton bud use.
- Paracetamol: Up to 4000mg/day PRN for pain.
